comments: Number of 4D hypercubes in n-dimensional hypercube. - _Henry Bottomley_, Apr 14 2000With four leading zeros, binomial transform of C(n,4). - _Paul Barry_, Apr 10 2003If X_1, X_2, ..., X_n is a partition of a 2n-set X into 2-blocks, then, for n>3, a(n) is equal to the number of (n+4)-subsets of X intersecting each X_i (i=1,2,...,n). - _Milan Janjic_, Jul 21 2007

formula: a(n) = 2*a(n-1) + A001789(n-1).G.f.: 1/(1-2*x)^5;  e.g.f.: exp(2*x)(x^4/4!) (with 4 leading zeros). - _Paul Barry_, Apr 10 2003
